Tucson Prime holds his stern expression yet he says nothing, knowing that t=
he com link between them was probably shut off, due to Rodimus's almost chi=
ld like behavior.  He heaves a sigh and grits his teeth and thinks to himse=
lf.

"Just as immature as the day he took the Matrix.  It's as I feared, he=
 wasn't ready for the responsibility and happened just to be at the wrong p=
lace at the wrong time and now after having it taken away, he's not ready t=
o assume the responsibility of leadership.  On the other hand, it's my faul=
t for not speaking up way back when.  Too laid back for my own good, and if=
 I knew Rodimus was going to be an aft about all this, I would've come forw=
ard and made the pledge myself.  It all makes sense now, Rodimus isn't prep=
ared for this yet I am.  Although, I've made some mistakes, and I admit it.=
  But I'm definitely learning from them and not taking it as some sort of n=
egative failure.  Just, a little bit of a set back.   All right Tucson Prim=
e, you know what you have to do, so why the pit are you procrastinating?"

=
Tucson Prime then realizes that when he transforms, his wrists retract.  Co=
uld he partially transform enough to get himself out of the hand restraints=
?  Then he realized, transformation was impossible.  He rethinks for a mome=
nt, and remembers the trick of making his wrists limber by taking them out =
of joint and refasetting them after the trick is done.  He goes with option=
 B and does the same trick Nightshift had done on his own wrists.  Slowly h=
e attempts it in his laying down position.  He moves his fingers around to =
see the easiest way on how to do it.  And then, with a slight pop, he disjo=
ints his wrists.

" Definitely something I won't be doing too often."

In N=
ight Shift's cell, the same trick is being used, as he manages to get his h=
ands out of the shackles by the dislocation maneuver.  He pops both wrists =
and all his internal structures back into place, and then rubs his wrists.
=

"Ow, don't wanna be don' that trick too often. That's torture."

Outside t=
he fortress, Quickstride can feel a massibe rumbling in his stomach.  It wa=
sn't Scourge that was scaring him, it was his overdosing of the gassy bean =
pods which was doing him in.  He remains in robot mode as he seems to bloat=
 a bit.

Rat Trap gasps.

"Uhhhh, ohhh...  This doesn't look too good and i=
t ain't gonna smell too good in a fraction of a few nanoseconds!"

Without =
further a do, Quickstride erupts with a cloud of unbearable stench, which w=
afts upward into the air.

the

f

is

 it, and now you have nothing to show buyt the darkness of that

e in."

 up on
